intro: Schoenus polyphyllus, commonly known as the many-leaf sedge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, rushes, and grasses. The plant is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Schoenus polyphyllus plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
